solution: Rewriting both sides with $3$ as the base, we have $81^{2x} = (3^4)^{2x} = 3^{8x}$ and $27^{3x-4} = (3^3)^{3x - 4} = 3^{9x - 12}$, and so our equation is $$3^{8x} = 3^{9x - 12}.$$Then, setting the exponents equal to each other, we obtain $$8x = 9x - 12.$$This yields our solution $\boxed{x = 12}.$
chatgpt_solution: We can also write $81 = 3^4$ and $27 = 3^3,$ so we have $$3^{8x} = 3^{9x - 12}.$$Then $8x = 9x - 12,$ so $x = \boxed{12}.$
